2. The second training rule on well-covered

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū hatthampi pādampi kīḷāpentā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū hattham pi pādam pi kīḷāpentāḥ antaraghare nisīdanti pe
translated: At that time the monks from the group of six were playing with their hands and feet while sitting in inhabited areas. …

analyzed: antaraghare nisīdissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will sit well-covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
One should be well-covered while sitting in an inhabited area.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca hatthaṁ vā pādaṁ vā kīḷāpento antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—🔽asañcicca,
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca hattham vā pādam vā kīḷāpentaḥ antaraghare nisīdati āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti  a san cit ca
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, plays with his hands and feet while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,🔽if he is sick,
if he is the first offender.🔽The sixth training rule is finished.
